item.description:
Apple Festival
Sunday, September 30, 2007 - noon to 5 p.m.
Back by popular demand our annual Apple Festival. Featuring the best pick your own apples in the area! Wander through the orchard among the acres of apple trees to find the perfect apple to take home. Savor a delicious caramel apple as well as some mouth watering apple crisp, a traditional barbecue and lots of ice cream treats. Enjoy the sounds of New Orleans! Appearing at the gazebo The Squeezebox Stompers performing a variety of Cajun, Zydeco, country blues and fiddle tunes. Also appearing at the gazebo is Bolton's own - Mike The Music Man Slattery. Entertaining children aged 1 - 10 and their families for the last twelve years. Mike?s shows are full of silly versions of the standards children love. Lots of stories, singing, dancing, and silliness. And as always, the wine shop is stocked with wines, beers and spirits for the fall and holiday season. Join us as we celebrate apples! Spend some quality time with the family and pick some apples!
item.name: Nashoba Valley Winery Apple Fest
